title: Who will Donald Trump announce as his choice for Secretary of State?
preds: Mitt Romney is officially out. Boosting Bob Corker. Bolton has no chance except as bad cop.

The heat is on RT faster than I thought, so time reduce it to barely get it. As we know DJT is as volatile as gas. If he reacts to attacks and see the R-leadership open to the Russian enquire, this might help some one to make a push in other direction other than the offered.
Dropping Rex Tillerson by 9 points due to some opposition. Kelly Ann Conway was a pollster, and I think they're testing public opinion every time they leak or announce a new candidate.
Agree with Censusguyz assessment; the political left is obsessed with ties to Russia, and will impact the decision. Also, is a Twitter announcement by @realDonaldTrump sufficient for resolution? :)
Russia sees Exxon boss, tipped to be Secretary of State, as an old friend. Trump & Putin are BFFs
The longer it takes  announce the more likely it is that Rex takes himself out of the running as Exxon will not want it's dealings around the world discussed before Congress.
With someone as Donald Trump I really feel like the "Dart Throwing Chimp!"
Tillerson shares his business world view. Romney does not and their are issues of loyalty. Bolton is my dark horse but he is not a Washington outsider.

Considerable opposition to Tillerson from the GOP, DT may need to find a different cover for Bolton.
http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-tillerson-idUSKBN14004D?il=0

Stay Tuned for the next episode!
https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/807970490635743237
Tillerson has good relations with Mr. Putin.
David Petraeus is still a possibility - though the events in his personal life may be perceived as having affected his suitability for the role.
Well, I was talkin' football with some guy at the Parkway Sports bar in Wichita Falls and it just sorta came up.
None resemble the power gester that is needed by the president-Elect.

It looks like unless concerns about Tillerson's ties with Russia derail it, he will be Trump's pick for SoS.  (The question only asks about the announcement of Trump's pick, not confirmation, or subsequent changes.)  I doubt Trump's base (or the Republican establishment) is very fond of links to Russia, but maybe he has already forgotten about them.

Tillerson seems to be willing to do it, and that is interesting to say the least, it seems DJT is trying to please someone, who we do not know the "whom" is! 
It does not take that much public back and forth to get to the candidate if done with temperance.
I have the feeling the present disarray in choosing this cabinet member has lots of black hand undertones.
Why no import someone from Russia now that we are widening the pickings?
Tillerson might be the import, he has been a good allied of the oily biz in Putin's Russia, so this choice seem to be a good choice, but the volatility of DJT leaves some room for someone else to be considered this week.
Tillerson's confirmation hearing, if he is the one, his dealings with dictators and bribery scandals while at XOM can put some fear for XOM present board, it might be XOM who prefers that Tillerson does not take it.
This one is another one with conflict of interests is written all over. So DJT gives a hoot about picking the best and draining the swamp, so far the swamp is providing good supply of swamp dwellers. Top that with a 500 million tax break that Tillerson will get if he gets confirmed, so far we are at $1,890 Million (or $1.8 billion) of tax breaks to the present cabinet so we can get to a $2.3 billion gift in tax breaks to its cabinet, that would be a record high by any measure. So I will give RX my higher chance, unless there another billionaire who needs a bigger tax break.
Apparently this has been confirmed, Tillerson is in.  Source, NBC News, CNBC, Reuters Twitter. No confirmation from Trump's camp yet.
Reports, and profile, all point to an almost certain Tillerson pick. Big changes coming.

NBC reports Tillerson for SoS (front for Bolton?).
http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-secretaryofstate-idUSKBN13Z0P7?il=0

I read yesterday that Rohrabacher may be the politically acceptable front for Bolton.The referenced link indicates Tillerson may be the business connected front.  In either event, it seems Bolton at under secretary is the real choice.
http://www.cnbc.com/2016/12/10/rex-tillerson-of-exxon-mobile-expected-to-be-named-trumps-secretary-of-state-sources.html
Corporate America now leads Foggy Bottom.

Trump will want someone who will do a good job but still be wiling to defer to Trump's erratic mood swings;  a very difficult combination. All of the mentioned candidates are weak on one or the other measure.  At this point, I think he's still beating the bushes for someone suitable, hence the high chance of picking someone else.

Tillerson is the one Trump wants, but may face serious opposition from the senate democrats http://www.cbsnews.com/news/mitt-romney-secretary-of-state-top-contender/. They may need to make one more pick to please the establishment, hence Romney could still be the choice. Also would be like Trump to pull another candidate out of left field.

Based on consensus and news that Giulani has eliminated himself as a possible contender. Rudy Giuliani removes himself from Trump Secretary of State consideration
http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/rudy-giuliani-contention-secretary-state-reports-article-1.2905109
Old rich white guy with political connections and liabilities?  Perfect!

Trump will be looking for someone like him but not at risk of putting him in the shadow, so no renown politician but someone from business. Petreaus could be another pick: a fallen star brought back to the stage would grant eternal gratitude to Trump. That would make him very valuable to Trump, and he is experienced.

Giuliani is out.
Rohrabacher may be a front for under secretary Bolton.
Guiliani and Romney are very unlikely.  Guiliani lacks everything.  Romney is just being toyed with by Trump as a cruel joke.

Base dislikes Romney intensely, but is preferred by outsiders. Rudy Giuliani will not be approved by Congress, but could still be nominated if Trump owes him a favor. John Bolton will face opposition in Congress for being hyper-emotional and war happy. The choice will likely be someone who is an industry leader with business experience, is a millionaire or billionaire, is loyal to Trump, and can get through confirmation. I need a little more research on Corker, Rohrabacher and Tillerson, whom I believe are the most likely choices. Or Trump may surprise by going with Mitt Romney.
Fox News (on twitter) has this list of candidates: Romney, Giuliani, Corker, Petraeus, Bolton, Tillerson, Rohrabacher, Manchin, Stavridis, Huntsman and Mulally.
Romney is almost surely out.  Corker is the next nearest to a grownup, so one is being optimistic here.
